headline: Has Cloudflare switched to a third-party Email MFA?
description:
I recently tried to log into my Cloudflare dashboard and received this message:

"You're attempting to log into Cloudflare from an unrecognized IP Address. Please enter the Authentication Token that was sent to the email associated with this account."

However, the emails that are coming into my mail server via graylisting (to a unique cloudflare email address) are from sparkpostmail.com and spmailtechno.com, both of which seem to be hosted through GoDaddy and have their DNS configured through AWS, which seems... odd, since Cloudflare has its own registrar and obviously provides DNS services.

Has anyone else see this? Is it legitimate?
